themes.label: Inventories
themes.rationale: The inscription provides a detailed list of sacred objects, including gold crowns, silver bowls, and incense burners, along with their specific weights.
themes.quote: φι λ[αι χρυ]σα 0 σταθμ ν το τον χχδδδδ κ ρε χρυσ[ε π] στ λες σταθμος πορ[α]ντ ριον [ργυρο]ν σταθμον στεφ νο χρυσ 0 σταθμ ν το τοι[ν 0]δ στ φανος χρυσος

themes.label: Accounts and Financial Records
themes.rationale: The text records the formal handover of sacred funds and treasures from one board of treasurers to their successors.
themes.quote: [παρ] [δοσαν το] ς ταμ αις ς [λυσικλ]ες δρακ[ο]ντ δο βατεθεν γραμμ[ τε]υε δεχσιθ ο[ι ---ασ] [ο]ι κα χσυν ρχοσι παραδ[εχσ μ]ενοι παρ τον προτ ρον ταμιον

themes.label: Lists of Officials or Citizens
themes.rationale: The inscription lists the names, patronymics, and demotics of the treasurers (tamiai) and secretaries (grammateis) responsible for the sacred property.
themes.quote: [τες θενα ας ναχσικρ]τ[ες λαμπτρε]ς κα χσυν [ρχοντες] ς ε χσενος ε φ νος προσπ[ λτι]ο[ς] γρ[αμμ] [τευε]

themes.label: Stele
themes.rationale: This type of Athenian financial record was traditionally inscribed on a stone stele for public display on the Acropolis.
themes.quote: σταθμος πορ[α]ντ ριον [ργυρο]ν σταθμον στεφ νο χρυσ 0 σταθμ ν το τοι[ν 0]δ στ φανος χρυσος

themes.label: Marble
themes.rationale: Athenian public records of the 5th century BCE, especially those from the Acropolis, were almost exclusively inscribed on Pentelic marble.
themes.quote: σταθμ ν το το ηη στ φανος χρυσος σταθμ ν [το το ---] ιι στεφ νε [χρυσε σταθμ ν τα τες 0]0 στ[ φα]νοι χρυσο

rationale: This inscription is a classic example of the Athenian 'Traditiones' (handover records) of the Treasurers of Athena. Dated to 417/6 BCE, it records the transfer of sacred items kept in the Hekatompedon (the cella of the Parthenon). The text follows a strict formula: naming the incoming and outgoing boards of treasurers and their secretaries, followed by an itemized list of precious metal objects (votives) with their weights recorded in the acrophonic numeral system.
